metadata.title: CVE-2021-47101 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: asix:fix uninit-value in asix_mdio_read() asix_read_cmd() may read less thansizeof(smsr) bytes and in this case smsr will be uninitialized. Fail log:BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value in asix_check_host_enabledrivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:82 [inline] BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value inasix_check_host_enable drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:82 [inline]drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:497 BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value inasix_mdio_read+0x3c1/0xb00 drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:497drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:497 asix_check_host_enabledrivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:82 [inline] asix_check_host_enabledrivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:82 [inline] drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:497asix_mdio_read+0x3c1/0xb00 drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:497drivers/net/usb/asix_common.c:497

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
